intro: Mesembryanthemum exustum, commonly known as the desert star, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptability to arid environments. The plant features thick, ribbed stems and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss, and it thrives in full sun with minimal water. Mesembryanthemum exustum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
